subject: Re: I am so very sad.
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Ann:

Recently, I personally have migrated to more reader than poster.  

I've enjoyed my time here listening to all the ideas, receiving 
helpful information, support, etc.  Thanks, to all here beginning 
with Frank S.  I have received what I felt I needed, and gave what I 
felt I was to share.

I guess all of us have our own role and path. My intentions are to 
continue following my inner leading and experiment/create, 
accordingly. That is my guide, always has been, yet I know it most 
likely will differ from others - that's what makes us all different 
and interesting in my opinion.  

I think it will be impossible to find one common idea, protocol, 
format, etc within this group.  That's O.K.  If anyone would like to 
establish a certain group of common protocol, ideals, etc, that is 
certainly OK, too. I take no issue with personal opinions regarding 
any of this.  

Best wishes to the group and all the experimenters...

LC
http://www.angelsghosts.com 



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
>
> Frank surprised me yesterday, privately telling me he might come 
back  
> to this list. I was hoping he'd pop up today and there would be a 
lot  
> of joy. I was very excited this morning, for a few short moments,  
> until I realized I'd already missed Frank's return *and* his 
departure.
> 
> I don't know if he will come back again. And I won't try to 
convince  
> him.
> 
> But if Frank does come back, I hope you all can understand that 
you  
> are all in the same place at this time *because of Frank.*
> 
> He doesn't owe anyone an explanation for why he does what he does,  
> with whom, and for whom. He doesn't need to believe that anyone is  
> more special than anyone or more deserving.
> 
> Things *are* getting a little messianic around here, HMO. And the 
one  
> thing I can say from watching this field for 30 years is that  
> messiahs come and go and never really are. What is are the little  
> glimpses of life after death, in other dimensions, and seemingly 
all  
> around us, invisible. That is the *only* verifiable truth of this,  
> HMO: *Something* is out there and it will talk to you, if you let 
it.  
> Beyond that, we are in no way prepared to make definitive 
statements.
> 
> No one should be asking Frank for anything at this point. He 
should  
> be free to gift his boxes on whomever he feels is the one that 
should  
> have it--or not at all.
> 
> Before anyone jumps on me, yes, I used to ask for a box from him,  
> because there were no other alternatives then and because we had  
> known each other on several other lists for about five years and 
were  
> friends.
> 
> Bu now there are alternatives--lots of them. Buy a minibox, like I  
> did. If that $400 price tag is too heavy, go to Radio Shack and 
make  
> a hack. The radio, rechargeable batteries, and an adaptor cost us 
$70.
> 
> No one should be asking Frank for anything at this point. He 
should  
> be free to gift his boxes on whomever he feels is the one that 
should  
> have it--or on no one at all. He doesn't owe anyone anything. He  
> already founded this feast.
> 
> Okay, enough out of me. I'm going to go weep in my tea.
> 
> Ann
>
